The Partnership

Chorley and South Ribble have operated a formal shared services arrangement since 2008, sharing a Chief Executive, senior management team, and several back-office functions. This is reflected clearly in the spending data.

South Ribble Borough Council is Chorley's third-largest supplier at £19.3 million (5.7% of total spend). Similarly, Chorley appears as a major supplier to South Ribble at £10.9 million.

What's Shared

The shared services model covers ICT, legal services, human resources, communications, and some planning functions. While the arrangement aims to deliver efficiencies, the cross-charging between councils makes it harder to assess true spending on individual services.

Impact on Analysis

When comparing Chorley and South Ribble to other Lancashire councils, it's important to account for these inter-council transfers. A significant portion of what appears as "external spend" is actually payment for shared internal services delivered by the partner council.
